When pollution despoils a natural waterway, it draws the dreaded nuckelavee to it from the [First World](/Planes.aspx?ID=10). This spirit of wrath is a grisly sight to behold: a horselike monstrosity with the gnarled upper body of a humanoid growing directly from its back. Further enhancing the awfulness, not a patch of skin exists on the misshapen hybrid form, as though it survived its own flaying. When a nuckelavee rides forth from its domain, it wreaks a trail of destruction across the lands surrounding its path. Nuckelavees are considered among the cruelest and most monstrous fey, seen by some as just desserts visited upon those who would befoul the waters of their homes. A nuckelavee, though, doesn't discriminate between those who pollute and those who merely have the misfortune to be in the wrong place at the wrong time. **[Recall Knowledge - Fey](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 26 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 24 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 21 [Nuckelavee](/Monsters.aspx?ID=743) **Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 186 2.0 **Perception** +16; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=23) **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Sylvan](/Languages.aspx?ID=10) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +19, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +19, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +16, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +18, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +16 **Str** +6 **Dex** +3 **Con** +4 **Int** +1 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +4 **Items** _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [bastard sword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=15)_ --- **AC** 28 **Fort** +19 **Ref** +16 **Will** +20 **HP** 190 **Immunities** [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126) **Weaknesses** cold iron 10 **[Frightful Presence](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=17)** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) 30 feet, DC 25
**Purity Vulnerability** Unpolluted fresh water burns a nuckelavee like acid, dealing 1d6 damage to it and causing it to be [sickened 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34). A nuckelavee can't heal from damage when it's in an area that isn't polluted (subject to GM discretion).
**[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)** --- **Speed** 40 feet, swim 40 feet **Melee** bastard sword +21 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [two-hand d12](/Traits.aspx?ID=198)), **Damage** 2d8+12 slashing plus 1d6 poison and mortasheen **Melee** jaws +20 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 2d8+12 piercing plus 1d6 poison and mortasheen **Melee** hoof +20, **Damage** 2d6+12 bludgeoning plus mortasheen **Primal Innate Spells** DC 28 - **3rd** [Stinking Cloud](/Spells.aspx?ID=309) - **5th** [Control Water](/Spells.aspx?ID=51) **Rituals** DC 28 - **4th** [Blight](/Rituals.aspx?ID=4) **Breath Weapon** ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The nuckelavee breathes a 30-foot cone of foulness, dealing 8d6 negative damage (DC 28 basic Fortitude save) to living creatures in the area. A creature that fails also takes 2d6 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29). The nuckelavee can't use Breath Weapon again for 1d4 rounds. **Mortasheen** ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46)) The target can't recover from the [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=15) condition caused by mortasheen until the disease is cured. Mortasheen gains the [virulent](/Traits.aspx?ID=162) trait against [animals](/Traits.aspx?ID=9) and [plants](/Traits.aspx?ID=125); **Saving Throw** DC 28 Fortitude; **Stage 1** Carrier with no ill effect (1 day); **Stage 2** [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10) and fatigued (1 day); **Stage 3** drained 2 and fatigued (1 day); **Stage 4** dead **[Trample](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=39)** Medium or smaller, hoof, DC 28
Unfortunate Victims Nuckelavees are equally delighted to murder and feed upon both hapless peasants and altruistic naturalists engaged in the process of cleaning up pollution. Indeed, those who would seek to purify such sites are often regarded as the greater threat by a nuckelavee, as without a befouled land to dwell in, the foul fey would wither away.
name: Nuckelavee
